metadata.Title: CVE-2012-6140 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
pam_google_authenticator.c in the PAM module in Google Authenticator before1.0 requires user-readable permissions for the secret file, which allowslocal users to bypass intended access restrictions and discover a sharedsecret via standard filesystem operations, a different vulnerability thanCVE-2013-0258.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-6140` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpam-google-authenticator - 20110413.68230188bdc7-1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: google-authenticator package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '20110413.68230188bdc7-1.1').
